channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2024060832
item.description:
Report X-2024060832

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKER WAS CALLED INTO THE DMP AND DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CONSULTED WITH THE DECISON TREE ON HOW TO PROCEED WITH THE CLEAN UP. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL FOLLOWING DECISON TREE GUIDLINES. RESPONDER BROUGHT THE LEAKER BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024060983
item.description:
Report X-2024060983

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-10
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE UNLOAD WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP AND SPILL AND PLACED ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER NOTED THAT ONE 1 GALLON WAS LEAKING. THE BOTTLE HAD A CRACK IN THE CAP AND A LOOSE SEAL. ALL MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THROUGH DMP.

item.title: Report E-2024060134
item.description:
Report E-2024060134

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was offloading drum from a trailer with a forklift when one of the forks punctured the drum causing a release of the hazardous waste. The material leaked through the trailer floor and onto the pavement below but did not contaminate any storm drains. The spill lasted approximately 2-3 minutes. Trained Veolia personnel responded to the spill and performed immediate cleanup of the release.
